no.motif

Class Reflect

  • java.lang.Object
    • no.motif.Reflect

  • public final class Reflect
extends Object
    Operations for doing reflection.

    • Field Detail

      • getClass

        public static final Fn<Object,Class<?>> getClass
        Gets the class of an object. This is the functional equivalent of the Object.getClass() method, which returns an untyped Class<?>.

      • name

        public static final Fn<Member,String> name
        Get the name of a Member, e.g. class name, method name, field name.

    • Method Detail

      • isA

        public static Predicate<Object> isA(Class<?> type)
        Evaluates if objects are of a certain type (class or interface).
        Parameters:
        type - The type that will satisfy the predicate.

      • type

        public static <T> Fn<T,Class<? extends T>> type()
        This is the same as getClass, with the additional possible typing of the yielded Classes.

      • annotatedWith

        public static Predicate<AnnotatedElement> annotatedWith(Class<? extends Annotation> annotation)
        Check if an element (class, method, field, etc) is annotated with a given annotation.
        Parameters:
        annotation - the annotation to check for.

      • newInstance

        public static <T> Fn<Class<? extends T>,T> newInstance()
        Create instances of classes using the no-arg constructor. Any checked InstantiationException or IllegalAccessException will be rethrown as RuntimeException.
